english: for; on account of; because of

etymology.description: Originally 又(又) (yòu, 'hand') + 象(象) (xiàng, 'elephant') = hand holding an elephant -> simplified to 为 for cursive script use
etymology.interpretation: 为(wèi) retains the basic meaning of 'for' or 'on account of' from the traditional character 為(為), simplified for ease through the cursive script process, representing the same concept with fewer strokes.
etymology.simplification: 为(wèi) was adopted from a cursive form of 爲(為), streamlining the character for modern usage while preserving its original components' associations.

examples.chinese: 我为你祝福(我為你祝福)。
他为家乡而奋斗(他為家鄉而奮鬥)。
我们为和平努力(我們為和平努力)，期盼世界安定(期盼世界安定)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen wèi hépíng nǔlì, qīpàn shìjiè āndìng.
examples.english: We work hard for peace, hoping the world will be stable.
